meanings.definition: The action or process of correcting something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher made some corrections to my homework to help me learn.
meanings.sent2: I always double-check my work for any corrections before submitting it.
meanings.sent3: After the robot made some funny corrections to the painting, it looked like a masterpiece!
meanings.sent4: Her corrections to the recipe turned a bland dish into a flavorful delight.
meanings.sent5: The corrections to the map were so precise that we never got lost again.

meanings.definition: Changes made to a piece of writing to improve it.
meanings.sent1: The editor suggested some corrections to the article for clarity.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate your corrections on my essay; it reads much better now.
meanings.sent3: The corrections to the story made it even more exciting to read.
meanings.sent4: Her corrections to the novel transformed it into a bestseller.
meanings.sent5: The corrections to the poem added depth and emotion to the verses.

meanings.definition: Punishment or discipline given to correct behavior.
meanings.sent1: The corrections for breaking the rules were fair and necessary.
meanings.sent2: He received corrections for his misbehavior in class.
meanings.sent3: The corrections for being late to work were having to wear a silly hat all day.
meanings.sent4: Her corrections for not completing the task on time were to stay late and finish it.
meanings.sent5: The corrections for talking during the movie were to sit in the front row next time.
